review_blob: On tap at Avery. Very nice Saison dry hopped with Lemondrop hops. The Lemondrop hops add a nice lemon and tea aroma alongside the yeast esters. Med body with a nice Saison yeast profile. Bread, light farmhouse, citrus.
On tap at Avery. Pink/red pour. Big ginger aromas w/ lt lactic acid. Med body w/ big lactic acid mouthfeel & ginger / beets. Dry tart finish.
On tap at Avery. Sour Pumpkin Ale! Copper / lt brown pour. Lactic acid nose w/ lt pumpkin/spice. Med body with nice blend of lactic acid, spice & oak.

On tap at Avery. Golden pour / white head. Sweet apple nose with some light bread notes. Medium body with apple/cider profile with some pale malt bready / light biscuit note. Dry and crisp. Nice hybrid.
on tap at Avery in July... brown pour... wonderful nose with layers of chai, chocolate, coffee and light caramel. med body. smooth throughout with a very well balance flavor profile.
Bottle. One of my favorite from the BA series. Deep orange pour. Big Cabernet nose w/ Port & lactic acid. Big lactic acid presence throughout w/ oak, Cabernet & dark fruits. Amazing!

On tap at Avery. Damn good stuff! Bourbon nose with dark fruits and light vanilla. Med to full body with a blend of bourbon, dark fruits, caramel and vanilla. Sweet, but drinkable. Excellent barrel aged blend.
On tap at Avery. Brown/Red pour. Mild bourbon nose with some light spices. Med body with a blend of spices, oak and bourbon. Enjoyable for sure.

On tap at Avery. Deep red pour. Raspberry nose with dark fruits. Med body with more raspberry, medium chipotle presence and deep dark fruits. The balance of fruit and pepper is very well done. Enjoyable.
On tap at Avery. Yellow pour / white head. Citrus and vanilla nose. Med body with wheat, citrus, vanilla and light spice.
Bomber. Hazy orange. Tart lemon nose w/ hay & Brett. Med body, lemons, Orange peel & a rustic farm/Brett character. Dry finish with tart lemon.
Taster at Coda. Very nice Saison w/ pleasant citrus esters and spicy phenols. The yeast is on display.
Taster at Coda. Orange pour. Deep citrus hop nose. Med to full body with pineapple & papaya. Citrus hop finish. Excellent!
Taster at Coda. Pitch blk. Amazing bourbon nose w/ vanilla. Full body w/ oak, vanilla, coconut, chocolate & coffee. Smooth & Soft. Some spice in the finish. Very damn good.
On tap at Parrys Pizza. Orange pour. Big citrus hop nose. Amarillo & Simcoe! Med body. Big orange notes through the body. Smooth finish with a soft bitterness.
Bomber. Orange pour. Citrus hop nose w/ yeast esters. Med body. Bright w/ citrus hop notes & yeast esters. Some barrel notes peeking through. Yum.
beer_name: Stone / Ecliptic / Wicked Weed Points Unknown IPA

review_blob: Red pour. Citrus / floral nose. Med to full body with more citrus hop flavors, some spice from the rye malt and a bright sticky finish.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada River Ryed Rye IPA

review_blob: Can. Very good session IPA. Pours light orange with a solid white head. Light citrus / wheat nose. Big citrus hop flavors w/ a smooth creamy body. Bitter finish.
Bottle on 4/4/15. Citrus / Brett / light oak nose. Med body. Brett notes throughout with lemon / light orange / light tart body. Excellent dry hopped sour with big Brett presence.
Bottle on 4/4/15. Yum! Currant nose with lactic acid and Brett. Tart body with more fruit and a dry tart finish. Dregs went in my fermenter.
At Choice City on 4/18/15. Nice Brett nose with earthy notes, hibiscus, sweet fruits and light cinnamon. Nice soft lactic acid profile through the finish.
Taster at Crooked Stave. Dark brown pour w/ ruby highlights. Port, dark fruits, red wine aromas. Med body - big red wine oak notes w/ tannins. Big lactic acid/oak. Excellent!
beer_name: Crooked Stave Nightmare On Brett (Red Wine)

review_blob: Taster @ Crooked Stave. Dark pink color. Tart blueberry nose. Med body with lactic acid and blueberries. Dry tart finish.
Taster at Crooked Stave. Light tart cherry nose. Pink color. Med body with a nice lactic acid flavor with light tart cherries.
Taster at Crooked Stave. Brett nose with citrus hop aromas. Light to med body. Rustic Brett flavors and dry finish. Nice level of Brett.
Taster at Crooked Stave. Hazy yellow pour. Nice lactic acid body with white wine notes. Acidic finish with more grapes.

Bottle. Pours light orange with a white head. Big lemon / orange nose with some sweeter aromas. Med body with big citrus hop flavors. Smooth bitter finish with some floral / spice notes on top of the citrus forward hop flavors. Clean, very drinkable.

bottle from Wilburs. Deep orange pour with a 1 finger off white head. Tequila barrel nose w/ salt & citrus. Big lactic acid mouthfeel w/ oak, lime & light Tequila. Balanced finish with the barrel character and the lactic acid blending perfectly.

Bottle. Pours deep orange / light red. Light bourbon nose w/ lactic acid & cherries. Full body w/ lactic acid, big tart cherries & oak. Acidic sweet finish. The barrel character really shines as you continue to drink it. Excellent!
beer_name: Avery Barrel-Aged Series 27 - Insula multos Collibus

review_blob: Taster at Powder Keg. Vanilla and oats on the nose with light coffee. Med body with coffee and vanilla. Slight sweet finish.
Taster at Powder Keg. Excellent Coffee Imperial Stout! The depth & flavor of coffee is perfect. Deep roasted malts shine w/ a creamy coffee finish.
Taster at Powder Keg. Golden pour. Peach aroma with some yeast esters. Nice peach flavor but lacking in the Brett.
Taster at High Hops. Golden hazy pour. Very piney with an herbal quality. Dank+. Enjoyable.
beer_name: High Hops Dr. Pats Double IPA

review_blob: Bottle. Pitch black pour. Deep roast. Chocolate, coffee and licorice. Very nice imperial stout.
Bottle. Rye malt in nose & finish. Odd hop clash in nose. Mandarin Bavaria hops really shine w/ citrus notes & peach flavors. Bitter finish.
Bottle. Loving the new Ruination 2.0! Big pine/fruit hop aromas w/ a med body filled with tropical fruit hop flavors. Some pine lingers.
On tap at Avery. Nice lactic acid nose with tart Raspberry. Lots of lactic acid throughout with a tart rustic Raspberry finish.
On tap at Choice City. Orange pour w/ white head. Orange aroma w/ Belgian yeast esters. Med body w/ huge orange flavors. Yeast ester finish.
Can. Brown pour w/ ruby highlights. Light coffee nose w/ chocolate and vanilla throughout. Nice but would like more coffee.
beer_name: 4 Noses Ritual Rivers Cocoa Coffee (Coffee Porter)

review_blob: On tap at Hops & Pie on 4/21/15. Fruit forward hops with a nice bitterness that doesnt linger. Extremely drinkable IIPA. Awesome!

On tap at Hops & Pie. Desert in a glass. Excellent aromas. Lots of vanilla and cinnamon. Tastes like a crumb cake or pie. Creamy body. Pretty sweet body. Very unique. Dont think I could get through a whole 750ml though.

Bomber. Take some fresh Old Guardian and dry hop it with a ton of fruity Amarillo & Simcoe hops! Essentially a Triple IPA! Huge citrus hop aromas. Big body loaded with fruit forward hops and some caramel malts. Big assertive finish. Awesome beer!
Bottle. Chocolate and sweet nose. Med body with a nice lactose presence covered in smooth chocolate. Very nice chocolate milk stout.
Leftovers from Christmas. Sweet raspberry nose. Med body with more raspberry. Sweet overall and a good fruit beer but not my thing.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic Raspberry Fruit Beer

review_blob: red IIPA w/ notes of chocolate malt, spices & caramel malts. Lighter body w/ a roasted finish. Not your go to IIPA, unique.

Can. An excellent IIPA that reminds me of Pliny. Pours a clear golden with a nice white head. Big citrus hop aromas. Med dry body and finish with more citrus forward hop flavors. Not too bitter. Very easy drinking.
beer_name: Lawsons Finest Sip of Sunshine IPA

review_blob: Can. Drank from the can and poured into a snifter. Out of the can you get a creamy fuller body with excellent fruit forward hop flavors. In the glass the body is a little more muted but you get the wonderful citrus and stone fruit hop aromas. Very hazy appearance. Overall an excellent IIPA that has more body than the west coast IIPAs. Big citrus / stone fruit forward hop notes. Nice bitterness - not over the top and very smooth and easy to drink. Lives up to the hype.

Bottle. Complex Brett aromas w/ lactic acid, light spices and Cabernet notes. Med body with bright lactic acid and rustic Brett funk. The wine barrels shine through the finish with big lactic acid notes.
beer_name: Avery Barrel-Aged Series 26 - Tectum et Elix

review_blob: On tap at Avery. Golden pour / white head. Belgian yeast esters on the nose with light stone fruits. Med body with light farmhouse notes and peaches. Bright dry finish.
On tap at Avery 4/19/15. Deep orange pour. Citrus nose w/ light Brett, wine and oak. Med body with barnyard flavors, a bit of lactic acid w/ cognac and orange peel. Tart finish w/ citrus.
